page.title: 04River Tay
page.content: Scotland's longest river is the River Tay. It is 120 miles long.The Tay starts at Ben Lui.The main places it flows through are Perth, Newburgh, Wormit, Dundee and Tayport then it ends at the North Sea. Main sports that are done on the Tay are salmon fishing and boating. Two of the biggest islands in the Tay are Mugdrum Island and Kerwhip Bank.Mugdrum Island is used for grazing cattle. Men go over to Kerwhip Bank to shoot duck and geese. In the past the long reeds which grow on Mugdrum and Kerwhip were used all over Scotland to make thatched roofs on houses. Many bridges cross the Tay. The most famous is the Rail Bridge near Dundee. The original bridge was blown down in a storm in 1884, but a new one was built. A new road bridge connects Fife with the centre of Dundee.
